title: Kinetic energy - analyzing position vs time graph

content.question: An object moves along a horizontal surface in a straight line and its position as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following statements best describes the kinetic energy of the object for the time interval shown in the graph?

choices.label: The kinetic energy of the object decreases uniformly for the first <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> seconds, then decreases uniformly at a higher rate for the next <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> seconds.

The kinetic energy of the object remains constant for the first <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> seconds and then changes to a higher constant value for the next <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> seconds.

The kinetic energy of the object remains constant for the first <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> seconds and then changes to a lower constant value for the next <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> seconds.

The kinetic energy of the object remains constant for the first <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> seconds and then decreases to zero over the next <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> seconds.

content.answer: The kinetic energy of the object remains constant for the first <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> seconds and then changes to a higher constant value for the next <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> seconds.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
